FuncDef:
The local-ipv6 command sets a local address of a DS-Lite tunnel.
The undo local-ipv6 command deletes a local address of a DS-Lite tunnel.
No local address of a DS-Lite tunnel is configured by default.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a local IPv6 address of a DS-Lite tunnel.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Specifies the local IPv6 address prefix of a DS-Lite tunnel.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 128.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A CPE and a DS-Lite device uses the local and remote IPv6 addresses to create a DS-Lite tunnel. If a DS-Lite receives IPv6 packets destined for an IPv6 address configured using the local-ipv6 command, the device considers them as DS-Lite tunnel packets.
Configuration Impact
The DS-Lite device forwards IPv6 packets destined for an IPv6 address configured using the local-ipv6 command to a service board for processing.
Precautions
A single local IPv6 address can be configured in each DS-Lite instance and must be different from a DS-Lite interface. If a specified local IPv6 address is the same as an existing interface address, the device displays an error message. The identical address causes the DS-Lite service to conflict with other services. A local IPv6 address can be configured in multiple DS-Lite instances.
